page.title: 15JOB SURVEY TAKEN IN SCHOOL.
page.content: We visited the juniors asking if they had close relatives over the age of sixteen that worked. We divided the jobs into vaious types and the results showed that 35 people worked in retail selling or delivering. We recorded 31 factory workers and 29 people privately employed. We expected fewer. Service and medical jobs came next they each had 21 workers. We thought there would be more medical workers as two hospitals are close by. There were 10 Council employees and 10 self employed,more than we expected.We counted 6 railway men but expected more, because of the importance of railways in Carlisle. Banks and post offices had 3 workers, and there was 1 farmer.We expected none in our town school.Our'any other'category included 1 office job,2 who worked in 14 M.U.,4 RAF men,1 pilot and a hotel worker.
